abstract: Laid-off workers at Waldorf Astoria Hotel will receive average payout of more than $142,000 after New York Hotel and Motel Trades Council union reaches record deal with hotel owner Hilton Worldwide that could pay up to $149 million in severance packages over two years.
lead_paragraph: Employees will receive 29 days of pay per year they worked, or 58 days if they are tipped employees; the average payout will be more than $142,000.

headline.main: Waldorf Astoria and Hotel Workers Union Reach $149 Million Deal for Severance Payouts
headline.print_headline: A Record Severance Deal for Waldorf’s Employees

snippet: Employees will receive 29 days of pay per year they worked, or 58 days if they are tipped employees; the average payout will be more than $142,000.
